definition: demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

sentences.chinese: 超脱是纯粹的，是纯真无邪。

sentences.english: Through the ages, the Opal has symbolized hope, innocence and purity.
sentences.chinese: 穿越年龄的界线，欧泊是象征希望，无邪，纯净。

sentences.english: Why are you in academy at such a young, innocent age?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么在这么年轻而无邪的年纪上大学？

sentences.english: There is an ingenue air about her.
sentences.chinese: 她有一种天真无邪的气质。

sentences.english: If my plan was naive, it didn't matter.
sentences.chinese: 我的计划天真无邪，但这无关重要。

sentences.english: What is innocence and why should it be cherished?
sentences.chinese: 天真无邪又是什么，为什么应该要珍惜赤子之心？

sentences.english: The righteous is not innocent of the deeds of the wicked
sentences.chinese: 行善守法者在恶人恶行中并非纯洁无邪。

sentences.english: Conservative think-tanks have the same dream of return to a prelapsarian innocence.
sentences.chinese: 保守派智囊团都梦想着能够回到过去天真无邪的日子。

sentences.english: Her innocent expression misled me into trusting her.
sentences.chinese: 她天真无邪的表情使得我误信了她。

sentences.english: Out of the murderous innocence of the sea.
I feel your purity and innocence from all across the world.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你的纯洁无邪，来自世界各地的。

sentences.english: So, I guess we’ve already proven you’re not a young innocent child.
sentences.chinese: 所以这足以证明，你不再是一个天真无邪的孩子了。

sentences.english: A heart whose love is innocent!
His servant was also a sort of innocent.
sentences.chinese: 他的女仆，也是个天真无邪的人物。

sentences.english: She is a pure young girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个纯真无邪的姑娘。

definition: to be laughing and playing/to giggle
